title: Contributing to ssdsims
text: outlines propose change ssdsims.

title: Contributing to ssdsims
text: can fix typos, spelling mistakes, grammatical errors documentation directly using GitHub web interface, long changes made source file. generally means ’ll need edit roxygen2 comments .R, .Rd file. can find .R file generates .Rd reading comment first line.

title: Contributing to ssdsims
text: want make bigger change, ’s good idea first file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s needed. ’ve found bug, please file issue illustrates bug minimal reprex (also help write unit test, needed).

title: Contributing to ssdsims
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("", fork = TRUE). Install development dependences devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. Begin commit merge messages - indicate user facing changes included NEWS.md. use fledge automatically generate NEWS.md file.

title: Contributing to ssdsims
text: New code follow tidyverse style guide. can use styler package apply styles, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. use testthat unit tests. Contributions test cases included easier accept.

title: Contributing to ssdsims
text: Please note ssdsims project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project agree abide terms.

title: Getting help with ssdsims
text: Thanks using ssdsims! filing issue, places explore pieces put together make process smooth possible.

title: Getting help with ssdsims
text: opening new issue, sure search issues pull requests make sure bug hasn’t reported /already fixed development version. default, search pre-populated :issue :open. can edit qualifiers (e.g. :pr, :closed) needed. example, ’d simply remove :open search issues repo, open closed.

title: Getting help with ssdsims
text: Start making minimal reproducible example using reprex package. haven’t heard used reprex , ’re treat! Seriously, reprex make R-question-asking endeavors easier (pretty insane ROI five ten minutes ’ll take learn ’s ). additional reprex pointers, check Get help! section tidyverse site.

text: Joe Thorley. Author, maintainer. Rebecca Fisher. Author.

what: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: goal ssdsims facilitate simulation studies species sensitivity distribution data.

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
code: library(ssdsims)  withr::with_seed(42, {   ssd_simulate_data(ssddata::ccme_boron, nsim =10) |>     ssd_fit_dists_sims() |>     ssd_hc_sims() }) #> # A tibble: 10 × 5 #>      sim stream data             fits       hc                #>    <int>  <int> <list>           <list>     <list>            #>  1     1      1 <tibble [6 × 5]> <fitdists> <tibble [1 × 15]> #>  2     2      1 <tibble [6 × 5]> <fitdists> <tibble [1 × 15]> #>  3     3      1 <tibble [6 × 5]> <fitdists> <tibble [1 × 15]> #>  4     4      1 <tibble [6 × 5]> <fitdists> <tibble [1 × 15]> #>  5     5      1 <tibble [6 × 5]> <fitdists> <tibble [1 × 15]> #>  6     6      1 <tibble [6 × 5]> <fitdists> <tibble [1 × 15]> #>  7     7      1 <tibble [6 × 5]> <fitdists> <tibble [1 × 15]> #>  8     8      1 <tibble [6 × 5]> <fitdists> <tibble [1 × 15]> #>  9     9      1 <tibble [6 × 5]> <fitdists> <tibble [1 × 15]> #> 10    10      1 <tibble [6 × 5]> <fitdists> <tibble [1 × 15]>  withr::with_seed(42, {   ssd_run_scenario(ssddata::ccme_boron, nsim = 10) }) #> # A tibble: 20 × 7 #>      sim stream replace  nrow data              fits       hc                #>    <int>  <int> <lgl>   <int> <list>            <list>     <list>            #>  1     1      1 FALSE       6 <tibble [6 × 5]>  <fitdists> <tibble [1 × 15]> #>  2     1      1 FALSE      10 <tibble [10 × 5]> <fitdists> <tibble [1 × 15]> #>  3     2      1 FALSE       6 <tibble [6 × 5]>  <fitdists> <tibble [1 × 15]> #>  4     2      1 FALSE      10 <tibble [10 × 5]> <fitdists> <tibble [1 × 15]> #>  5     3      1 FALSE       6 <tibble [6 × 5]>  <fitdists> <tibble [1 × 15]> #>  6     3      1 FALSE      10 <tibble [10 × 5]> <fitdists> <tibble [1 × 15]> #>  7     4      1 FALSE       6 <tibble [6 × 5]>  <fitdists> <tibble [1 × 15]> #>  8     4      1 FALSE      10 <tibble [10 × 5]> <fitdists> <tibble [1 × 15]> #>  9     5      1 FALSE       6 <tibble [6 × 5]>  <fitdists> <tibble [1 × 15]> #> 10     5      1 FALSE      10 <tibble [10 × 5]> <fitdists> <tibble [1 × 15]> #> 11     6      1 FALSE       6 <tibble [6 × 5]>  <fitdists> <tibble [1 × 15]> #> 12     6      1 FALSE      10 <tibble [10 × 5]> <fitdists> <tibble [1 × 15]> #> 13     7      1 FALSE       6 <tibble [6 × 5]>  <fitdists> <tibble [1 × 15]> #> 14     7      1 FALSE      10 <tibble [10 × 5]> <fitdists> <tibble [1 × 15]> #> 15     8      1 FALSE       6 <tibble [6 × 5]>  <fitdists> <tibble [1 × 15]> #> 16     8      1 FALSE      10 <tibble [10 × 5]> <fitdists> <tibble [1 × 15]> #> 17     9      1 FALSE       6 <tibble [6 × 5]>  <fitdists> <tibble [1 × 15]> #> 18     9      1 FALSE      10 <tibble [10 × 5]> <fitdists> <tibble [1 × 15]> #> 19    10      1 FALSE       6 <tibble [6 × 5]>  <fitdists> <tibble [1 × 15]> #> 20    10      1 FALSE      10 <tibble [10 × 5]> <fitdists> <tibble [1 × 15]>

title: Parameter Descriptions for Package — params
text: Default parameter descriptions may overridden individual functions.

title: Parameter Descriptions for Package — params
text: ... Unused. args named list argument values. ci flag specifying whether estimate confidence intervals (bootstrapping). dist_sim character vector specifying distributions fitdists object ""`` distributions /"top"use distribution weight  /"multi"` treat distributions single distribution. nrow numeric vector number rows generated data must 5 1,000, nsim count number data sets generate. pars named list parameter values. replace logical vector specifying whether sample replacement. seed integer starting seed NULL. start_sim count number simulation start . stream count stream number. .progress Whether show purrr::progress bar.

title: Parameter Descriptions for Package — params
text: flag non-missing logical scalar. string non-missing character scalar.

title: Fit SSD Distributions to Simulated Data — ssd_fit_dists_sims
text: x data frame sim stream integer columns list column data frames fit distributions . dists character vector distribution names. ... Additional arguments passed ssdtools::ssd_fit_dists(). seed integer starting seed NULL. silent flag indicating whether fits fail silently. .progress Whether show purrr::progress bar.

title: Fit SSD Distributions to Simulated Data — ssd_hc_sims
text: x data frame sim stream integer columns list column fitdists objects. proportion numeric vector proportion values estimate hazard concentrations . ... Additional arguments passed ssdtools::ssd_hc(). ci flag specifying whether estimate confidence intervals (bootstrapping). seed integer starting seed NULL. save_to NULL string specifying directory save bootstrap datasets parameter estimates (successfully converged) . .progress Whether show purrr::progress bar.

title: Fit SSD Distributions to Simulated Data — ssd_hc_sims
text: x tibble list column hc data frames produced applying ssd_hc() fits.

title: Run Scenario — ssd_run_scenario
text: Run Scenario

title: Run Scenario — ssd_run_scenario
code: ssd_run_scenario(x, ...)  # S3 method for class 'data.frame' ssd_run_scenario(   x,   ...,   nrow = c(6L, 10L),   replace = FALSE,   dists = ssdtools::ssd_dists_bcanz(),   proportion = 0.05,   ci = FALSE,   seed = NULL,   nsim = 100L,   stream = getOption("ssdsims.stream", 1L),   start_sim = 1L,   .progress = FALSE )  # S3 method for class 'fitdists' ssd_run_scenario(   x,   ...,   nrow = c(6L, 10L),   dist_sim = "top",   dists = ssdtools::ssd_dists_bcanz(),   proportion = 0.05,   ci = FALSE,   seed = NULL,   nsim = 100L,   stream = getOption("ssdsims.stream", 1L),   start_sim = 1L,   .progress = FALSE )  # S3 method for class 'tmbfit' ssd_run_scenario(   x,   ...,   nrow = c(6L, 10L),   dists = ssdtools::ssd_dists_bcanz(),   proportion = 0.05,   ci = FALSE,   seed = NULL,   nsim = 100L,   stream = getOption("ssdsims.stream", 1L),   start_sim = 1L,   .progress = FALSE )  # S3 method for class 'character' ssd_run_scenario(   x,   ...,   nrow = c(6L, 10L),   args = list(),   dists = ssdtools::ssd_dists_bcanz(),   proportion = 0.05,   ci = FALSE,   seed = NULL,   nsim = 100L,   stream = getOption("ssdsims.stream", 1L),   start_sim = 1L,   .progress = FALSE )  # S3 method for class '`function`' ssd_run_scenario(   x,   ...,   nrow = c(6L, 10L),   args = list(),   dists = ssdtools::ssd_dists_bcanz(),   proportion = 0.05,   ci = FALSE,   seed = NULL,   nsim = 100L,   stream = getOption("ssdsims.stream", 1L),   start_sim = 1L,   .progress = FALSE )

title: Run Scenario — ssd_run_scenario
text: x object use scenario. ... Unused. nrow positive whole number minimum number non-missing rows. replace logical vector specifying whether sample replacement. dists character vector distribution names. proportion numeric vector proportion values estimate hazard concentrations . ci flag specifying whether estimate confidence intervals (bootstrapping). seed integer starting seed NULL. nsim count number data sets generate. stream count stream number. start_sim count number simulation start . .progress Whether show purrr::progress bar. dist_sim character vector specifying distributions fitdists object ""`` distributions /"top"use distribution weight  /"multi"` treat distributions single distribution. args named list argument values.

title: Run Scenario — ssd_run_scenario
text: tibble nested data sets.

title: Run Scenario — ssd_run_scenario
text: ssd_run_scenario(data.frame): Run scenario using data.frame sample data ssd_run_scenario(fitdists): Run scenario using fitdists object generate data ssd_run_scenario(tmbfit): Run scenario using tmbfit object generate data ssd_run_scenario(character): Run scenario using name function generate sequence random numbers ssd_run_scenario(`function`): Run scenario data using function generate sequence random numbers

title: Run Scenario — ssd_run_scenario
code: ssd_run_scenario(ssddata::ccme_boron, nsim = 2) #> # A tibble: 4 × 7 #>     sim stream replace  nrow data              fits       hc                #>   <int>  <int> <lgl>   <int> <list>            <list>     <list>            #> 1     1      1 FALSE       6 <tibble [6 × 5]>  <fitdists> <tibble [1 × 15]> #> 2     1      1 FALSE      10 <tibble [10 × 5]> <fitdists> <tibble [1 × 15]> #> 3     2      1 FALSE       6 <tibble [6 × 5]>  <fitdists> <tibble [1 × 15]> #> 4     2      1 FALSE      10 <tibble [10 × 5]> <fitdists> <tibble [1 × 15]>  fit <- ssdtools::ssd_fit_dists(ssddata::ccme_boron) ssd_run_scenario(fit, dist_sim = c("lnorm", "top"), nsim = 3) #> # A tibble: 12 × 7 #>      sim stream  nrow dist_sim data              fits       hc                #>    <int>  <int> <int> <chr>    <list>            <list>     <list>            #>  1     1      1     6 lnorm    <tibble [6 × 1]>  <fitdists> <tibble [1 × 15]> #>  2     1      1     6 top      <tibble [6 × 1]>  <fitdists> <tibble [1 × 15]> #>  3     1      1    10 lnorm    <tibble [10 × 1]> <fitdists> <tibble [1 × 15]> #>  4     1      1    10 top      <tibble [10 × 1]> <fitdists> <tibble [1 × 15]> #>  5     2      1     6 lnorm    <tibble [6 × 1]>  <fitdists> <tibble [1 × 15]> #>  6     2      1     6 top      <tibble [6 × 1]>  <fitdists> <tibble [1 × 15]> #>  7     2      1    10 lnorm    <tibble [10 × 1]> <fitdists> <tibble [1 × 15]> #>  8     2      1    10 top      <tibble [10 × 1]> <fitdists> <tibble [1 × 15]> #>  9     3      1     6 lnorm    <tibble [6 × 1]>  <fitdists> <tibble [1 × 15]> #> 10     3      1     6 top      <tibble [6 × 1]>  <fitdists> <tibble [1 × 15]> #> 11     3      1    10 lnorm    <tibble [10 × 1]> <fitdists> <tibble [1 × 15]> #> 12     3      1    10 top      <tibble [10 × 1]> <fitdists> <tibble [1 × 15]>  fit <- ssdtools::ssd_fit_dists(ssddata::ccme_boron) ssd_run_scenario(fit[[1]], nsim = 3) #> # A tibble: 6 × 6 #>     sim stream  nrow data              fits       hc                #>   <int>  <int> <int> <list>            <list>     <list>            #> 1     1      1     6 <tibble [6 × 1]>  <fitdists> <tibble [1 × 15]> #> 2     1      1    10 <tibble [10 × 1]> <fitdists> <tibble [1 × 15]> #> 3     2      1     6 <tibble [6 × 1]>  <fitdists> <tibble [1 × 15]> #> 4     2      1    10 <tibble [10 × 1]> <fitdists> <tibble [1 × 15]> #> 5     3      1     6 <tibble [6 × 1]>  <fitdists> <tibble [1 × 15]> #> 6     3      1    10 <tibble [10 × 1]> <fitdists> <tibble [1 × 15]>  ssd_run_scenario("rlnorm", nsim = 3) #> # A tibble: 6 × 6 #>     sim stream  nrow data              fits       hc                #>   <int>  <int> <int> <list>            <list>     <list>            #> 1     1      1     6 <tibble [6 × 1]>  <fitdists> <tibble [1 × 15]> #> 2     1      1    10 <tibble [10 × 1]> <fitdists> <tibble [1 × 15]> #> 3     2      1     6 <tibble [6 × 1]>  <fitdists> <tibble [1 × 15]> #> 4     2      1    10 <tibble [10 × 1]> <fitdists> <tibble [1 × 15]> #> 5     3      1     6 <tibble [6 × 1]>  <fitdists> <tibble [1 × 15]> #> 6     3      1    10 <tibble [10 × 1]> <fitdists> <tibble [1 × 15]>  ssd_run_scenario(ssdtools::ssd_rlnorm, nsim = 3) #> # A tibble: 6 × 6 #>     sim stream  nrow data              fits       hc                #>   <int>  <int> <int> <list>            <list>     <list>            #> 1     1      1     6 <tibble [6 × 1]>  <fitdists> <tibble [1 × 15]> #> 2     1      1    10 <tibble [10 × 1]> <fitdists> <tibble [1 × 15]> #> 3     2      1     6 <tibble [6 × 1]>  <fitdists> <tibble [1 × 15]> #> 4     2      1    10 <tibble [10 × 1]> <fitdists> <tibble [1 × 15]> #> 5     3      1     6 <tibble [6 × 1]>  <fitdists> <tibble [1 × 15]> #> 6     3      1    10 <tibble [10 × 1]> <fitdists> <tibble [1 × 15]>

title: Generate Data for Simulations — ssd_simulate_data
text: family functions generate tibble nested data sets.

title: Generate Data for Simulations — ssd_simulate_data
code: ssd_simulate_data(x, ...)  # S3 method for class 'data.frame' ssd_simulate_data(   x,   ...,   nrow = 6L,   replace = FALSE,   seed = NULL,   nsim = 100L,   stream = getOption("ssdsims.stream", 1L),   start_sim = 1L,   .progress = FALSE )  # S3 method for class 'fitdists' ssd_simulate_data(   x,   ...,   nrow = 6L,   dist_sim = "top",   seed = NULL,   nsim = 100L,   stream = getOption("ssdsims.stream", 1L),   start_sim = 1L,   .progress = FALSE )  # S3 method for class 'tmbfit' ssd_simulate_data(   x,   ...,   nrow = 6L,   seed = NULL,   nsim = 100L,   stream = getOption("ssdsims.stream", 1L),   start_sim = 1L,   .progress = FALSE )  # S3 method for class 'character' ssd_simulate_data(   x,   ...,   nrow = 6L,   args = list(),   seed = NULL,   nsim = 100L,   stream = getOption("ssdsims.stream", 1L),   start_sim = 1L,   .progress = FALSE )  # S3 method for class '`function`' ssd_simulate_data(   x,   ...,   nrow = 6L,   args = list(),   seed = NULL,   nsim = 100L,   stream = getOption("ssdsims.stream", 1L),   start_sim = 1L,   .progress = FALSE )

title: Generate Data for Simulations — ssd_simulate_data
text: x object use generating data. ... Unused. nrow numeric vector number rows generated data must 5 1,000, replace logical vector specifying whether sample replacement. seed integer starting seed NULL. nsim count number data sets generate. stream count stream number. start_sim count number simulation start . .progress Whether show purrr::progress bar. dist_sim character vector specifying distributions fitdists object ""`` distributions /"top"use distribution weight  /"multi"` treat distributions single distribution. args named list argument values.

title: Generate Data for Simulations — ssd_simulate_data
text: tibble nested data sets.

title: Generate Data for Simulations — ssd_simulate_data
text: ssd_simulate_data(data.frame): Generate data sampling data.frame ssd_simulate_data(fitdists): Generate data fitdists object ssd_simulate_data(tmbfit): Generate data tmbfit object ssd_simulate_data(character): Generate data using name function ssd_simulate_data(`function`): Generate data using function generate sequence random numbers

title: Generate Data for Simulations — ssd_simulate_data
code: ssd_simulate_data(ssddata::ccme_boron, nrow = 5, nsim = 3) #> # A tibble: 3 × 5 #>     sim stream  nrow replace data             #>   <int>  <int> <dbl> <lgl>   <list>           #> 1     1      1     5 FALSE   <tibble [5 × 5]> #> 2     2      1     5 FALSE   <tibble [5 × 5]> #> 3     3      1     5 FALSE   <tibble [5 × 5]>  fit <- ssdtools::ssd_fit_dists(ssddata::ccme_boron) ssd_simulate_data(fit, nrow = 5, nsim = 3) #> # A tibble: 3 × 5 #>     sim stream  nrow args             data             #>   <int>  <int> <dbl> <list>           <list>           #> 1     1      1     5 <named list [2]> <tibble [5 × 1]> #> 2     2      1     5 <named list [2]> <tibble [5 × 1]> #> 3     3      1     5 <named list [2]> <tibble [5 × 1]>  fit <- ssdtools::ssd_fit_dists(ssddata::ccme_boron) ssd_simulate_data(fit[[1]], nrow = 5, nsim = 3) #> # A tibble: 3 × 5 #>     sim stream  nrow args             data             #>   <int>  <int> <dbl> <list>           <list>           #> 1     1      1     5 <named list [2]> <tibble [5 × 1]> #> 2     2      1     5 <named list [2]> <tibble [5 × 1]> #> 3     3      1     5 <named list [2]> <tibble [5 × 1]>  ssd_simulate_data("rnorm", nrow = 5, nsim = 3) #> # A tibble: 3 × 5 #>     sim stream  nrow args       data             #>   <int>  <int> <dbl> <list>     <list>           #> 1     1      1     5 <list [0]> <tibble [5 × 1]> #> 2     2      1     5 <list [0]> <tibble [5 × 1]> #> 3     3      1     5 <list [0]> <tibble [5 × 1]>  ssd_simulate_data(ssdtools::ssd_rlnorm, nrow = 5, nsim = 3) #> # A tibble: 3 × 5 #>     sim stream  nrow args       data             #>   <int>  <int> <dbl> <list>     <list>           #> 1     1      1     5 <list [0]> <tibble [5 × 1]> #> 2     2      1     5 <list [0]> <tibble [5 × 1]> #> 3     3      1     5 <list [0]> <tibble [5 × 1]>

title: ssdsims 0.0.0.9002
text: previous version.

title: ssdsims 0.0.0.9001
text: Merge pull request #30 poissonconsulting/joethorley/issue21. Merge branch ‘main’ github.com:poissonconsulting/ssdsims. Pass … ssd_run_scenario(). Add .progress = FALSE argument. Add ci = FALSE argument. Merge pull request #22 poissonconsulting/fits. Merge pull request #20 poissonconsulting/fits. Add start_stream = 1L argument. Renamed skip start_seeds. Rename ssd_get_seeds() ssd_get_streams_seeds(). Merge branch ‘main’ seeds. Added ssd_get_seeds(). generate_data() vectorized nrow. Added ssd_generate_data().

title: ssdsims 0.0.0.9000
text: Added NEWS.md file track changes package.
